bill_title: criminalize the sponsorship of false political advertisements or campaign literature and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to criminalize the sponsorship of false political advertisements or campaign literature and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 12-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may knowingly sponsor with actual malice a political advertisement or campaign literature that: (1) Contains a false statement of material fact; (2) Represents that a candidate is the incumbent for the office sought if in fact the candidate is not the incumbent; or (3) Makes, either directly or indirectly, a false claim stating or implying the support or endorsement of any person or organization if in fact the candidate does not have such support or endorsement. Actual malice is to act with knowledge of falsity or with reckless disregard as to truth or falsity. Any person violating the provisions of this section is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor. Paid political advertising includes all campaign literature and advertisements as described in § 12-25-4.1 as well as all advertising conveyed to voters through telephonic or other electronic voter contact programs.
